name: HD 190647
scenarioDescription:
The HD 190647 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 190647 is a star with 1.07 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.38 times its radius. It is located 177.95 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 7.957 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 190647 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 190647 system


HD 190647 b

HD 190647 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.23 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 190647 b is 631.23 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 190647 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 190647, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by La Silla Observatory.
